item.title: 5 Apple TV Movies You Should Stream This Week (October 13 - 19)
item.dc:creator: Derek Malcolm
item.description: Apple TV+ may now be known as Apple TV, but it still offers a weekly selection of great movies to watch.
item.content:encoded: This week's roundup of great movies to watch comes with a bit of news specific to this particular streaming service. In a press release announcing the premiere date of F1 The Movie, Apple TV+ has quietly changed its name, dropping the "+" and is now just "Apple TV."

item.title: The Naya Create Is the Specialty Keyboard System for When Time and Money Are No Object
item.dc:creator: Bill Loguidice
item.description: Naya Create is a premium modular keyboard system that encourages a new way to work.
item.content:encoded: In a sea of me-too keyboard and mouse designs, it's refreshing when a product like the Naya Create attempts to break the mold. Unfortunately, this modular keyboard system proves more enthusiast's experiment than something that's ready for the mass market.

item.title: Your PC Feels Slow? Microsoft Says These Two Windows 11 Settings Are to Blame
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.description: Configure these settings for a performance boost.
item.content:encoded: Everyone wants their Windows PCs to offer the best performance. Apps should open instantly, there shouldn't be any lag when switching windows, and the system itself should boot immediately. However, if any of these aspects feel a bit sluggish, Microsoft says it could be due to your OneDrive file syncing settings and your computer's visual effects.

item.title: How to Enroll for Continued Windows 10 Security Updates
item.dc:creator: Timothy Jacob Hudson
item.description: Official Windows 10 support is ending very soon, but if you aren't ready to upgrade, you can still enroll for security updates for another year.
item.content:encoded: On October 14th, Microsoft will be officially ending support for Windows 10. However, if you aren't ready to upgrade yet, you can sign up for Extended Security Updates so you can continue getting important security patches beyond 2025. There are a few steps needed to enroll in ESU.

item.title: 6 Reasons Your Graphics Card Is Overheating
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: Even a small issue can make your card run dangerously hot.
item.content:encoded: If you've noticed your graphics card running hotter than usual, there are a few common culprits likely to blame. Modern cards often feature robust cooling solutions that help it maintain maximum clock speeds and performance, but some problems are simply inevitable with any GPU.

item.title: 10 Portable Apps That I Always Keep On a Flash Drive
item.dc:creator: Chifundo Kasiya
item.description: Get to work immediately wherever you go.
item.content:encoded: You never know when a certain Windows app can help solve an immediate problem. You may not always have time to download and install what you need. But luckily, there are several useful ones with portable versions that can fit on your thumb drive.

item.title: Your Nest Thermostats Are Getting New Faces
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: You have four new faces to choose from.
item.content:encoded: Your Nest Learning Thermostat (4th Gen) is getting a major visual upgrade with the rollout of four brand new Farsight faces. This is great news because the default face can get dull quickly. These new options will join the four existing Farsight faces, meaning you have eight total.

item.title: This 24-Year-Old App Is Still My Favorite System Monitor for Windows
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.content:encoded: Anyone who has ever tried to customize their copy of Windows will inevitably run into Rainmeter. It lets you put all kinds of heavily customizable widgets on the Windows desktop. Windows has never given us much in the way of customization, and in the latest versions, widgets are missing entirely. If youâ€™re a fan of widgets and visual monitors, or if you just enjoy a pretty desktop, let me show why Rainmeter is perfect for the job.

item.title: 6 Functions That Changed How You Use Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Dynamic array functions were a game-changer.
item.content:encoded: The introduction of dynamic arrays triggered the biggest change to how we work with Microsoft Excel formulas in years, if not decades. They allow a single formula to spill multiple results into adjacent cells and resize automatically, replacing the less flexible legacy Ctrl-Shift-Enter (CSE) array formulas.
